definition: to be happy/to be in a good mood
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.chinese: “乔，别打趣了，”南希没好气地说。

sentences.english: Under aerobic or anaerobic conditions, nitrates could be used as nitrogen sources.
sentences.chinese: 在好气或厌气条件下可以硝酸盐为氮源。

sentences.english: I ask him very nicely if he'd like a cup of tea.
sentences.chinese: 我好声好气问他要不要来杯茶。

sentences.english: That sort of thing makes me sick, " he said roughly ."
sentences.chinese: “这种事叫我恶心，”他没好气地说。

sentences.english: According to McKittrick, He reamed us out but good.
sentences.chinese: 按照麦克凯特里克上尉的说法，他没好气地挖苦我们。

sentences.english: It is a facultative aerobe and the most suitable temperature for its growth is 30 ℃.
sentences.chinese: 该菌株的最适生长温度为30℃，好气生长。

sentences.english: You guys aren’t even nice to your customers.
sentences.chinese: 你们对顾客根本都没有好气儿。

sentences.english: He was in bad mood, and showed no humor towards anyone.
sentences.chinese: 他这几天心情不好，对人没好气儿。
“我不知道该怎么做，”我没好气地说。

sentences.english: Looking at his confused face, I felt annoyed.
sentences.chinese: 看到他迷惑不解的脸，我又好气又好笑。

sentences.english: Some fungi as well as bacteria can denitrify under aerobic environment.
sentences.chinese: 有些真菌和细菌能在好气条件下进行反硝化。

sentences.english: He tends to snap at people when he gets inpatient.
sentences.chinese: 他一不耐烦的时候就对人没有好气。

sentences.english: "Fine, " I snap. "Just feeling a little unwanted. "
sentences.chinese: “好，”我没好气地说，“只是感觉有点不受欢迎。”

sentences.english: A charged gas that is completely closed ball can airtight.
sentences.chinese: 充好气的球可以说是完全封闭不透气的。

sentences.english: Usually I articulate the vocabulary into the sound I want it to be, which makes you partially angry, but funny also.
sentences.chinese: 常常把单字念成自己想要的发音，让你又好气又好笑。

sentences.english: Aunt Chloe set a chair for her in a manner decidedly gruff and crusty.
sentences.chinese: 克罗大娘没好气地替她搬了把椅子。

definition: variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
to be angry about sth but also find it laughable
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/both funny and extremely embarrassing/between laughter and tears
